title: Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 37 (American
description:
Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 37 (American Issues3):

American Issues were also addressed in Collection 13 & 17 of this series. Additionally, almost all of the other collections contain books that examine their issues from the American perspective. Here, we have 34 titles:

-  Alperovitz - America Beyond Capitalism; Reclaiming Our Wealth, Our Liberty, and Our Democracy (2005)

-  Andreas - Smuggler Nation; How Illicit Trade Made America (2013)

-  Barr - No Slack; the Financial Lives of Low-Income Americans (2012)

-  Berg - Sexism in America; Alive, Well, and Ruining Our Future (2009)

-  Brawley & Goldberg - How We Do Harm; a Doctor Breaks Ranks about Being Sick in America (2011)

-  Carville & Greenberg - It's the Middle Class, Stupid (2012)

-  Duany - Suburban Nation; the Rise of Sprawl and the Decline of the American Dream (2000)

-  Eberstadt - A Nation of Takers; America's Entitlement Epidemic (2012)

-  Ferguson - Colossus; the Rise and Fall of the American Empire (2005)

-  Gowan - Hobos, Hustlers, and Backsliders; Homeless in San Francisco (2010)

-  Grant - Hope and Despair in the American City; Why There Are No Bad Schools in Raleigh (2009)

-  Gross - Unreal Estate; Money, Ambition, and the Lust for Land in Los Angeles (2011)

-  Hayes - Twilight of the Elites; America after Meritocracy (2012)

-  Ingraham - Of Thee I Zing; America's Cultural Decline from Muffin Tops to Body Shots (2011)

-  Jaffe - New York at War; Four Centuries of Combat, Fear, and Intrigue in Gotham (2012)

-  Kusmer - Down and Out, On the Road; the Homeless in American History (2002)

-  Lynd - Lucasville; the Untold Story of a Prison Uprising, 2e (2011)

-  Massey & Denton - American Apartheid; Segregation and the Making of the Underclass (1993)

-  Noah - The Great Divergence; America's Growing Inequality Crisis and What We Can Do about It (2013)

-  O'Connell - Sugar Nation; the Hidden Truth behind America's Deadliest Habit and the Simple Way to Beat It (2011)

-  Packer - The Unwinding; an Inner History of the New America (2013)

-  Pierce - Idiot America; How Stupidity Became a Virtue in the Land of the Free (2010)

-  Schwiezer - Extortion; How Politicians Extract Your Money, Buy Votes, and Line Their Own Pockets (2013)

-  Shally-Jensen (Ed.) - Encyclopedia of Contemporary American Social Issues; Vols. 1, 2, 3 & 4 (2011)

-  Smith - Men on Strike; Why Men Are Boycotting Marriage, Fatherhood, and the American Dream - and Why It Matters (2013)

-  Smith & Kiger - Oops; 20 Life Lessons from the Fiascoes That Shaped America (2006)

-  Sowell - Barbarians Inside the Gates and Other Controversial Essays (1999)

-  Stein - Pivotal Decade, How the United States Traded Factories for Finance in the Seventies (2010)

-  Stout - The Feel-Good Curriculum; the Dumbing-Down of America's Kids in the Name of Self-Esteem (2000)

-  Sykes - A Nation of Moochers; America's Addiction to Getting Something for Nothing (2011)

-  Tonry - Punishing Race; a Continuing American Dilemma (2011)

-  Tyler - What Went Wrong; How the 1% Hijacked the American Middle Class.. and What Other Countries Got Right (2013)

-  Walker - Presidents and Civil Liberties from Wilson to Obama; a Story of Poor Custodians (2012)

-  Walker - The United States of Paranoia; a Conspiracy Theory (2013)
